cvl/cvl_hdr.h File Reference

High dynamic range frames. More...


Functions

void cvl_tonemap_drago03 (cvl_frame_t *dst, cvl_frame_t *src, float max_abs_lum, float bias, float max_disp_lum)
void cvl_tonemap_durand02 (cvl_frame_t *dst, cvl_frame_t *src, float max_abs_lum, int k, float sigma_spatial, float sigma_luminance, float base_contrast)

Detailed Description

Handling High Dynamic Range (HDR) frames.
All tone mapping operators (TMOs) take normalized CVL_XYZ frames as input. If you have CVL_XYZ frames with absolute values, you need to convert them with cvl_luminance_range() first. TMOs that work on absolute luminance values have an additional parameter called max_abs_lum. If the maximum absolute luminance is known, this parameter can be set accordingly. If the maximum absolute luminance is not known, the parameter can be used to prescale the values to a suitable range.

Function Documentation

void cvl_tonemap_drago03 ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
float  max_abs_lum,
float  bias,
float  max_disp_lum 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
max_abs_lum Maximum absolute luminance.
bias Bias.
max_disp_lum Maximum display luminance.
Applies tone mapping to the high dynamic range frame src and writes the result to dst. Input and output must be in CVL_XYZ format.
The bias parameter must be from [0,1]. The max_disp_lum parameter must be greater than zero. See also: F. Drago, K. Myszkowski, T. Annen and N. Chiba, Adaptive Logarithmic Mapping For Displaying High Contrast Scenes. Proc. Eurographics 2003.

void cvl_tonemap_durand02 ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
float  max_abs_lum,
int  k,
float  sigma_spatial,
float  sigma_luminance,
float  base_contrast 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
max_abs_lum Maximum absolute luminance.
k Mask size 2*k+1 x 2*k+1.
sigma_spatial Spatial sigma.
sigma_luminance Luminance sigma.
base_contrast Base contrast.
Applies tone mapping to the high dynamic range frame src and writes the result to dst. Input and output must be in CVL_XYZ format.
The sigma values must be greater than zero, and the base_contrast parameter must be grater than 1. See also: F. Durand and J. Dorsey, Fast Bilateral Filtering for the Display of High-Dynamic-Range Images, Proc. ACM SIGGRAPH 2002, pp. 257-266.
